Detailed Description

This class implements the Gaussian Mixture Model unsupervised learning.

It uses the EM learning algorithm and is based on the plEMLearner class.

See Also
plLearnMixtureModel

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum plLearnGMM::InitializationMethod

Enum for initialization methods.

See Also
set_initialization_method()
Enumerator
GMM_RANDOM_INIT 

Random initialization in variable ranges.

GMM_KMEANS_FORGY_INIT 

k-means Forgy method.

GMM_KMEANS_RANDOM_PARTITION_INIT 

k-means random partition method.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

plLearnGMM::plLearnGMM ( const plVariablesConjunction &  ObsVars,
size_t  n_mixture,
bool  independent_dimensions = false 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
[in]ObsVarsThe variables on which the GMM will be learned
[in]n_mixtureThe number of components (kernels) of the mixture
[in]independent_dimensionsIf 'true', ObsVars are assumed to be independent (i.e., diagnonal conarianace matrix)
plLearnGMM::plLearnGMM ( const plVariablesConjunction &  ObsVars,
const std::vector< size_t > &  n_mixture_candidates,
bool  independent_dimensions = false 
)

Constructor.

Parameters
[in]ObsVarsThe variables on which the GMM will be learned
[in]n_mixture_candidatesThe candidate number of components (kernels) of the mixture. Choosing among this candidates will be based on the optimality score (as defined by set_optimality_score() among BIC, AIC, ...)
[in]independent_dimensionsIf 'true', ObsVars are assumed to be independent (i.e., diagnonal conarianace matrix)

Member Function Documentation

virtual plDistribution plLearnGMM::get_initialization_cluster ( const plVariablesConjunction &  X,
size_t  c,
size_t  trial 
) const
protectedvirtual

Get an initialization Normal distribution (cluster) P(X | C=c).

The default implementation returns a random Normal (Gaussian) distribution constructed as follows:

plDistribution plLearnGMM::get_initialization_cluster(const plVariablesConjunction &X,
size_t nc, size_t trial)
{
if(X.dim() == 1) {
return plNormal(plSymbol(X),
range_[0].first + plRandomFloat(range_[0].second - range_[0].first),
std::sqrt(variance_[0]));
}
else {
plFloatVector mean(X.dim());
plFloatMatrix Sigma(X.dim(), X.dim());
for(size_t i = 0; i < X.dim(); ++i) {
mean[i] = range_[i].first + plRandomFloat(range_[i].second - range_[i].first);
Sigma[i][i] = variance_[i];
}
return plNormal(X, mean, Sigma);
}
}

Implements plLearnMixtureModel.

void plLearnGMM::set_diagonal_covariance ( bool  diagonal_covariance = true)
inline

Set/unset independent variables hypothesis (i.e., diagonal covariance matrix)

Has no effect in one-dimensional case

void plLearnGMM::set_initialization_parameters ( size_t  variable,
plFloat  min_val,
plFloat  max_val,
plFloat  variance 
)
inline

Set components (clusters) initialization parameters for each dimension.

Parameters
[in]variablethe variable (dimension) for which the parameters are set
[in]min_valThe minimal value of the range
[in]max_valThe maximal value of the range
[in]varianceThe variance

These parameters will be used by the default get_initialization_cluster() function

See Also
get_initialization_cluster()
